page.title: 15ECOLOGY IN NORTH FAREHAM 2
page.content: WILDLIFE The noise of our approach ensured we saw very little of the wildlife but we discovered evidence of a large and varied wildlife population from spoors,droppings and interviews from local people.We were surprised to find 3 small herds of deer living in the copse and coming out at dusk or early morning to feed on the cereals and grassland.There is a large rabbit population especially on Wickham Common.The spoors of foxes and badgers were found on the footpaths along the cereal fields and in the woodland. The homes of mice and fieldmice were discovered in the cereal fields.A dead bat close to the tower of Knowle Hospital suggests a bat colony close by.Rabbit shooting and foxhunting are local activities.
